draw_surface_tiled: This function will take a surface and then repeatedly tile it across the whole room, starting from the coordinates that you give in the function.

NOTE: When working with surfaces there is the possibility that they can cease to exist at any time due to them being stored in texture memory. You should ALWAYS check that a surface exists using surface_exists() before referencing them directly.
The unique ID value of the surface to draw.
The x position of where to draw the surface.
The y position of where to draw the surface.
This will draw the surface indexed in "surf" at the instances own x and y position, and tiled in every direction in the room.
